oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Red Foley Show - 1950-05-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Red Foley Show, originally broadcast May 18, 1950 at 9:00 am (CST), part 1. Featuring announcer David Cobb, host/performer Red Foley with the Cumberland Valley Boys, and performers the Owen Bradley Quintet with vocalists Dottie Dillard and Jack Shook, the Jordanaires, and Grady Martin. An NBC syndication originating at WSM, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Cumberland Valley Boys; Owen Bradley Quintet; Dottie Dillard; Jack Shook; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (David Cobb) -- Theme (Hominy Grits) -- David Cobb introduces Red Foley -- Opening statement (Red Foley) -- Night Train To Memphis (Red Foley) -- David Cobb and Red Foley talk -- Red Foley introduces the Owen Bradley Quintet, Dottie Dillard, and Jack Shook -- Blues Stay Away From Me (Owen Bradley Quintet, Dottie Dillard, Jack Shook) -- Red Foley tells a story -- Red Foley introduces the Jordanaires -- Dry Bones (Jordanaires) -- Red Foley and David Cobb talk [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: National Broadcasting Company; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Red Foley show (Radio program); Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Cobb, David (Announcer); Jordanaires (Musical group); Cumberland Valley Boys; Bradley, Owen; Owen Bradley Quintet; Hughes, Marvin; Smith, Beasley; Dillard, Dottie; Shook, Jack
